internetChatbot.title: Internet chatbot
internetChatbot.description: A general purpose chatbot designed to answer queries via the internet

deepThought.title: Deep Thought
deepThought.description: A deep research agent designed to assist with comprehensive research by pulling many sources from online

characterRoleplay.title: Character roleplay
characterRoleplay.description: Create an agent to roleplay as a character from a fantasy world

personalAssistant.title: Personal assistant
personalAssistant.description: Chat between a user and a personal assistant designed to enhance the user's productivity

scratch.title: Start from scratch
scratch.description: Start with an empty agent with minimal default tools and a blank initial memory state

customerSupport.title: Customer support
customerSupport.description: An agent designed to answer customer support requests

companion.title: Companion
companion.description: Chat between a user an an AI companion named Sam, designed to learn and adapt over time

sleepTime.title: Companion (sleep-time enabled)
sleepTime.description: A companion that uses our new sleep-time architecture

voiceSleepTime.title: Voice Companion (sleep-time enabled)
voiceSleepTime.description: A voice companion that uses our new sleep-time architecture

ADE/InstructionsView.instructionsTooltip: Optional instructions for how the agent should use data in this folder

TemplateDescription.label: Description
TemplateDescription.placeholder: Enter a description for your template...
TemplateDescription.tooltip: Add a description to help others understand what this template is for and how to use it

errors.createFolderError: Failed to create folder. Please try again.
errors.attachFolderError: Failed to attach folder to agent. Please try again.

ADE/NetworkInspector.title: Network Inspector
ADE/NetworkInspector.description: The network inspector allows you to inspect how the ADE interfaces with the agent's backend. This will not show GET requests, only POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE requests, it will also not show message requests, as these are handled by the agent simulator.

noRequestsInfo.title: No requests made yet
noRequestsInfo.description: This view shows any POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE requests made in the ADE, it does not show GET requests or message requests. It will only show requests made while the Network Inspector is open and will clear requests when this is closed.

ADE/ModifyToolBehaviorPopover.error: There was an error modifying the tool behavior, please try again or contact support.
ADE/ModifyToolBehaviorPopover.exitLoop: Agent must stop if this tool is called
ADE/ModifyToolBehaviorPopover.continueLoop: Agent will never stop at this tool
ADE/ModifyToolBehaviorPopover.requiredBeforeExit: Agent will always run this tool before exiting
ADE/ModifyToolBehaviorPopover.runFirst: Agent will run this tool first

confirmLeave.title: Are you sure you want to leave?
confirmLeave.description: You are about to leave the tool rules editor, any unsaved changes will be lost.

ToolRuleList.error: There was an error saving your rules, please try again or contact support, resetting to last saved state.

confirmRemove.title: Are you sure you want to remove this rule?

ExitLoopToolEditor.sentence: <tool></tool> will stop the agent's execution loop after being called.
ExitLoopToolEditor.description: Tool will stop the agent's execution loop after being called.

ContinueToolRule.sentence: Agent loop will not stop at <tool></tool>
ContinueToolRule.description: Agent loop will not stop at this tool.

RequiredBeforeExitToolEditor.sentence: <tool></tool> must be called before the agent exits the loop
RequiredBeforeExitToolEditor.description: Tool must be called before the agent exits the loop

ChildToolRuleEditor.sentence: <tool></tool> must be followed by calling the tool:
ChildToolRuleEditor.description: Tool must be followed by calling the tool

StartConstraintToolEditor.sentence: <tool></tool> will be called before the agent does anything else when the agent is invoked
StartConstraintToolEditor.description: Tool will be called before the agent does anything else when the agent is invoked.

MaxCountPerStepToolRuleEditor.sentence: <tool></tool> can be called a maximum of <count></count> times in a loop
MaxCountPerStepToolRuleEditor.description: Tool can be called a maximum of

runFirst.title: Start Constraint
runFirst.description: Specify the first tool called on each agent invocation

exitLoop.title: Exit Loop
exitLoop.description: Force the agent to stop executing

constrainChildTools.title: Constrain Child Tools
constrainChildTools.description: Require one tool to follow another tool

conditional.title: Conditional
conditional.description: Run a tool based on a condition from another tool

continueLoop.title: Continue Loop
continueLoop.description: Prevent a tool from being the start or end of a loop

requiredBeforeExit.title: Required Before Exit
requiredBeforeExit.description: Require a tool to be called before the agent exits the loop

maxCountPerStep.title: Max Count Per Step
maxCountPerStep.description: Limit the number of times a tool can be called in a loop

ADE/AgentVariablesModal.noVariablesInDeployedAgentWithNoTemplate: Variables allow you to programatically define parts of an agent's memory that can be customized per-user on agent creation. Variables are only available in templates - to use variables, click 'Create template' in the top right.

MemoryVariableEditor.keyError: Keys must start with a letter or an underscore and can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores
MemoryVariableEditor.label: Edit Memory Variables
MemoryVariableEditor.notSupported: Memory variables allow you to inject variables into the agent's memory on creation. This feature is only available on our cloud platform.
MemoryVariableEditor.details: Memory variables are injected into the agent's memory on creation. To use a memory variable, simply add it to your core memory with the following syntax: <syntax></syntax>

ToolVariables.noVariables: No tool variables in this agent
ToolVariables.keyError: Keys must start with a letter or an underscore and can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores
ToolVariables.label: Edit tool variables

details.cloud: Tool variables are exposed in tool calls. Agent-scoped tool variables superceed global tool variables. To configure your global tool variables, modify them in your <link>organization settings</link>.
details.local: Tool variables are exposed in tool calls. Agent-scoped tool variables superceed global tool variables set in your computer's environment variables.

ADE/AdvancedSettings.title: Advanced
ADE/AdvancedSettings.errorLoadingModelParameters: There has been an error loading model parameters, please refresh the page or contact support.

errors.tooSmall: Please set your context window size to at least 4000.

ContextWindowSlider.error: Invalid context window size, minimum value is 4000
ContextWindowSlider.label: Context window
ContextWindowSlider.tooltip: The maximum number of tokens the model can process in a single request, including both input and output. Larger windows allow for more context but may increase costs / lower speed.

TemperatureSlider.label: Temperature
TemperatureSlider.error: Invalid temperature value, must be between 0 and 1
TemperatureSlider.tooltip: Controls randomness in responses. Lower values (0.0) make responses more focused and deterministic, higher values (1.0) make them more creative and varied.

MaxTokensSlider.label: Max output tokens
MaxTokensSlider.error: Invalid max output tokens value, minimum value is 1024
MaxTokensSlider.exceedsContextWindow: Max tokens cannot exceed context window ({contextWindow})
MaxTokensSlider.tooltip: The maximum number of tokens the model can generate in its response. Setting this limit helps control response length and costs.

EnableMaxTokensSwitch.label: Enable max output tokens
EnableMaxTokensSwitch.tooltip: When enabled, explicitly limits the model's response length. When disabled, uses the model's default maximum.

MaxReasoningTokensSlider.label: Max reasoning tokens
MaxReasoningTokensSlider.error: Invalid max reasoning tokens value, minimum value is 1024

ReasoningEffortDropdown.label: Reasoning effort
ReasoningEffortDropdown.tooltip: Controls the level of reasoning effort for models that support it (e.g., OpenAI o-series, GPT-5). Higher effort allows for more thorough reasoning but may increase response time and costs.

VerbosityLevelDropdown.label: Verbosity level
VerbosityLevelDropdown.tooltip: Controls how verbose the GPT-5 model's output should be. Higher verbosity provides more detailed responses.

MessageBufferLengthSlider.label: Message buffer length
MessageBufferLengthSlider.error: Failed to persist message buffer length value
MessageBufferLengthSlider.rangeError: Invalid message buffer length value, range must be between 4 and 256
MessageBufferLengthSlider.tooltip: The number of messages to keep in memory before triggering a memory update.

messageBufferAutoclear.label: Reset message buffer
messageBufferAutoclear.tooltip: If enabled, the agent will not remember messages from previous steps (though the agent will still retain state via memory). Not recommended unless you have an advanced use case.

sleeptimeAgentFrequency.invalidInput: Frequency must be greater or equal to 1
sleeptimeAgentFrequency.label: Sleep-time agent frequency
sleeptimeAgentFrequency.tooltip: The step frequency at which the sleep-time agent is invoked. Set to 1 to run the sleep-time agent on every primary agent step.
sleeptimeAgentFrequency.error: Failed to update sleep-time agent frequency value

maxFilesOpen.label: Max files open
maxFilesOpen.tooltip: Maximum number of files that can be open at once for this agent. Setting this too high may exceed the context window, which will break the agent

windowCharLimit.label: Per-file view character limit
windowCharLimit.tooltip: The per-file view window character limit for this agent. Setting this too high may exceed the context window, which will break the agent

reasoning.label: Reasoning
reasoning.disabledTooltip: Reasoning cannot be disabled for this model

AgentSettingsOnboarding.title: Agent Templates
AgentSettingsOnboarding.description: Define your agent's blueprint here. Configure the LLM model, tools, and system prompts that form your template - perfect for deploying multiple agents that share the same core design but with personalized information.

QuickADEOnboarding.welcome: Welcome to your Agent Development Environment
QuickADEOnboarding.description: Welcome to your workspace for creating, editing and deploying AI agents. Let's start with a quick tour.

done.label: Congratulations
done.part1: You just created your first agent with Letta  👾
done.part2: To integrate agents into your end application, see additional resources for:

ADEOnboarding.description: Welcome to your workspace for creating, editing and deploying AI agents. Let's start with a quick tour.

ViewMessageTrace.description: Below is the message history for this trace. You can see the input and output messages, as well as the tools used by the agent.
ViewMessageTrace.title: View message

QuickOnboarding.title: Understanding memory
QuickOnboarding.description:
Your agent can learn over time by rewriting parts of the context window, organized into memory blocks. 

This memory block is dedicated to storing what the agent learns about the human (you)!

ADE/EditCoreMemoriesPanel.advancedEditorDisabledDueToSimulated: The advanced editor is not available for simulated memoires, switch back to template to edit

MemoryOnboarding.title: Core Memory
MemoryOnboarding.description:
Core Memory consists of blocks that form persistent knowledge always available in your agent's context window.

The 'Template' tab shows the initial memory blocks for agents deployed from this template, while the 'Simulated' tab displays the memory of the current simulated agent (in your ADE).

SimulatedMemory.error: There was an error while reading the simulated memory block, please try again or contact support.

agent.label: Blocks
agent.tooltip: Memory blocks are always visible read/write sections of the context window

templated.label: Template
templated.tooltip: The template memory is the initial memory state for any new deployed agents that use this template

simulated.label: Simulated
simulated.tooltip: The memory state of the simulated agent (reset when you flush the simulator)

ADE/EditCoreMemoriesPanel.title: Core Memory ({count})
ADE/EditCoreMemoriesPanel.infoTooltip: Editable, in-context memory of the agent that can be templated with variables
ADE/EditCoreMemoriesPanel.error: There was an error while updating the memory block, please try again or contact support.

role.label: Click here to switch roles, the current role is {role}

image.dropImagesHere: Drop images here to add to chat
image.modelDoesNotSupportImages: The model does not support image input, but you can still send this message.

ui-component-library/InteractiveSystemMe.title: System Message
ui-component-library/InteractiveSystemMe.truncated: This message is too long to display, click here to view the full message

ui-component-library/CopyWithCodePreview.description: The code below will be copied to your clipboard:

ADE/AdvancedCoreMemoryEditor/DetachMemor.title: Detach Memory Block
ADE/AdvancedCoreMemoryEditor/DetachMemor.description: Are you sure you want to detach this memory block? This will remove the memory block from this agent, but any other agents that use this memory block will still have it.
ADE/AdvancedCoreMemoryEditor/DetachMemor.error: There was an error detaching this memory block, please try again or contact support.

ConfirmLeave.title: Are you sure you want to leave?
ConfirmLeave.description: You are about to leave the memory editor, any unsaved changes will be lost.

DetachMemoryBlockDialog.title: Detach Memory Block
DetachMemoryBlockDialog.description: Are you sure you want to detach this memory block? This will remove the memory block from this agent, but any other agents that use this memory block will still have it.
DetachMemoryBlockDialog.error: There was an error detaching this memory block, please try again or contact support.

EditorContent.empty: Please select or create a memory block to view or edit

DeleteMemoryBlockDialog.title: Delete Memory Block
DeleteMemoryBlockDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete this memory block? This is permanent and cannot be undone, this will delete the memory block, if this memory block is used in other agents, it will also be deleted from those agents.
DeleteMemoryBlockDialog.error: There was an error deleting this memory block, please try again or contact support.

MemoryWarning.title: You may need to update your system instructions
MemoryWarning.message: Adjusting the memory label may require you to update your system instructions to reflect the new memory label.

AdvancedMemoryEditorForm.error: There was an error updating your memory, please try again or contact support

preserveOnMigration.label: Preserve on migration
preserveOnMigration.tooltip: If enabled, this memory block will be preserved when migrating the agent to a new version. This is useful for memories that could be updated by the agent.

description.label: Description
description.tooltip: An optional description for your memory block, used by the agent to understand the memory block's purpose.

readOnly.label: Read-only
readOnly.tooltip: If enabled, this memory block will not be editable by the agent. This is useful for system instructions or other read-only data that should only be set by the developer.

label.label: Label
label.error: Labels must be alphanumeric and underscores or dashes only, and cannot start with a number

delete.title: Delete Memory
delete.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this memory?

label.label: Memory Label

QuickOnboarding.title: Message your agent
QuickOnboarding.description:
You can chat with the agent in the chat view, or through the Letta API. 

Try telling the agent something about yourself!

FeedbackButtons.error: There was an error processing your feedback, please check the network inspector to see the error details or contact support.

InvalidMessages.title: There was an error processing the message response
InvalidMessages.description: This is usually caused by an LLM returning bad data or an improper configuration of your LLM config, you can read the unprocessed response in your server logs or browser inspect element.

AgentSimulatorOnboarding.title: Viewing agent execution
AgentSimulatorOnboarding.description:
You can view the agents execution in the ADE, which shows reasoning, tool calls, and messages. 

For more details, you can select the dropdown.

ShareAgentDialog.launchLinkDescription: This agent is managed by a launch link, and cannot be shared.
ShareAgentDialog.title: Share agent chat
ShareAgentDialog.description: Share your agent with others by providing them with a link to this chat

everyone.label: Everyone
everyone.description: Anyone with the link can access the agent

organization.label: Organization
organization.description: Only people in your organization can access the agent

loggedIn.label: Logged in
loggedIn.description: Only people logged in to Letta can access the agent

restricted.label: Restricted
restricted.description: Only you can access the agent

hasFailedToSendMessageText.cloud: Failed to send message, please try again or contact support

hasFailedToSendMessageText.rateLimitExceeded: Rate limit reached, please wait a few moments before trying again.

zapier.description: Zapier MCP gives your AI assistant direct access to over 7,000+ apps and 30,000+ actions without complex API integrations.
zapier.instructions: To connect Zapier to Letta, you need to set up your Zapier account to use the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Visit the <link>Zapier MCP website</link> to generate your Zapier API key, and paste it above.

github.description: GitHub MCP gives your AI assistant direct access to GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, and more for seamless development workflows.
github.instructions: To connect GitHub to Letta, you need to create a GitHub Personal Access Token. Visit the <link>GitHub MCP Server repository</link> for detailed setup instructions, then paste your token above.

apify.description: Apify MCP gives your AI assistant access to over 5,000+ web scraping and automation Actors for data extraction and task automation.
apify.instructions: To connect Apify to Letta, you need to provide your Apify API token. Visit the <link>Apify MCP documentation</link> for setup instructions, then paste your API token above.

deepwiki.description: DeepWiki provides up-to-date documentation you can talk to, for every repo in the world. Think Deep Research for GitHub.
deepwiki.instructions: DeepWiki is a free service that provides access to documentation and search capabilities for GitHub repositories. No authentication required.

stripe.description: Stripe MCP gives your AI assistant direct access to Stripe's payment APIs, customer data, and financial operations for seamless payment integrations.
stripe.instructions: To connect Stripe to Letta, you need to provide your Stripe API key. Visit the <link>Stripe MCP documentation</link> for setup instructions, then paste your API key above.

pipedream.description: Pipedream provides 2,700+ APIs and 10,000+ tools in a single MCP server. Get your unique server URL from mcp.pipedream.com after connecting your accounts.
pipedream.instructions: Visit <link>mcp.pipedream.com</link> to sign up, connect your accounts, and get your unique server URL. Then paste your server URL here to connect.

exa.description: Exa MCP gives your AI assistant real-time web search, research, and company analysis using Exa's powerful API. Includes tools for web, academic, company, and GitHub search.
exa.instructions: To connect Exa to Letta, you need an Exa API key. Visit the <link>Exa MCP documentation</link> to get your API key and setup instructions, then paste your API key above.

huggingface.description: Hugging Face MCP gives your AI assistant access to thousands of open-source models, datasets, and tools from the Hugging Face ecosystem.
huggingface.instructions: Hugging Face MCP is a free service that provides access to models and datasets. No authentication required. Visit the <link>Hugging Face MCP website</link> to learn more.

composio.description: Composio provides access to thousands of tools and services through a single HTTP stream connection. No API keys needed - just connect your accounts and get your unique server URL.
composio.instructions: Visit <link>mcp.composio.dev</link> to sign up, connect your accounts, and get your unique server URL. Then paste your server URL here to connect.

ToolManager/ToolVariables.title: Environment Variables
ToolManager/ToolVariables.description: Environment variables can be used to store arbitrary data that can be used in your agent. This is useful for storing data that is not part of the agent's memory, such as API keys or other configuration data.

TooManyToolsWarning.tooltip: You have {count} tools attached. Agent performance typically degrades with more than {threshold} tools. CreateNewMemoryBlockDialog/ExampleBlocks.details: Click on a block below to prepopulate the form with example values. You can then edit the values as needed.

human.title: Human
human.description: A memory block for keeping track of the human (user) the agent is interacting with.

persona.title: Persona
persona.description: A memory block for storing the agent's core personality details and behavior profile.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: A memory block for storing information about an organization the agent belongs to.

description.label: Description
description.placeholder: Brief description of this memory block's purpose

value.label: Value
value.placeholder: Initial content for this memory block

characterLimit.label: Character Limit
characterLimit.description: Maximum number of characters allowed in this memory block

readonly.label: Read-only
readonly.description: When enabled, this memory block cannot be modified by the agent

preserveOnMigration.label: Preserve on migration
preserveOnMigration.description: When enabled, this memory block will be preserved when migrating the agent to a new template version. This is useful for memories that could be updated by the agent.

errors.labelFormat: Label must start with a letter, underscore, or hyphen and contain only letters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens
errors.labelExists: A memory block with this label already exists
errors.characterLimitMustBeNumber: Character limit must be a number

errors.attachError: Failed to attach memory block to agent
